abstract: One way for Medicare Part D enrollees to deal with the “doughnut hole” is to insure themselves against it. Another way is to simply not get involved with Part D in the first place.
snippet: One way for Medicare Part D enrollees to deal with the “doughnut hole” is to insure themselves against it. Another way is to simply not get involved with Part D in the first place.
lead_paragraph: One way for Medicare Part D enrollees to deal with the “doughnut hole” is to insure themselves against it. Another way is to simply not get involved with Part D in the first place.

headline.main: There Are Alternatives: Insuring to Bridge the Gap or Opting Out
headline.print_headline: There Are Alternatives: Insuring to Bridge the Gap or Opting Out
